trans-unit.source: Determines the location of a resource with the specified type and name in the specified module

seg-source.mrk: Determines the location of a resource with the specified type and name in the specified module

target.mrk: Determines the location of a resource with the specified type and name in the specified module

trans-unit.source: Handle to the module whose executable file contains the resource.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the module whose executable file contains the resource.

target.mrk: Handle to the module whose executable file contains the resource.

trans-unit.source: A value of 0 specifies the module handle associated with the image file that the operating system used to create the current process.

seg-source.mrk: A value of 0 specifies the module handle associated with the image file that the operating system used to create the current process.

target.mrk: A value of 0 specifies the module handle associated with the image file that the operating system used to create the current process.

trans-unit.source: The type of the resource. This parameter can be string or integer value.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be string or integer value.

target.mrk: This parameter can be string or integer value.

trans-unit.source: The name of the resource. This parameter can be string or integer value.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be string or integer value.

target.mrk: This parameter can be string or integer value.

trans-unit.source: Handle to the specified resource's information block.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the specified resource's information block.

target.mrk: Handle to the specified resource's information block.

trans-unit.source: To obtain a handle to the resource, pass this handle to the _WinAPI_LoadResource() function.

seg-source.mrk: To obtain a handle to the resource, pass this handle to the _WinAPI_LoadResource() function.

target.mrk: To obtain a handle to the resource, pass this handle to the _WinAPI_LoadResource() function.

trans-unit.source: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

trans-unit.source: If the first character of the string of the $sName or $sType parameter is a pound sign (#), the remaining characters represent a decimal number that specifies the integer identifier of the resource's name or type.

seg-source.mrk: If the first character of the string of the $sName or $sType parameter is a pound sign (#), the remaining characters represent a decimal number that specifies the integer identifier of the resource's name or type.

target.mrk: If the first character of the string of the $sName or $sType parameter is a pound sign (#), the remaining characters represent a decimal number that specifies the integer identifier of the resource's name or type.

trans-unit.source: For example, the string "#258" represents the integer identifier 258.

seg-source.mrk: For example, the string "#258" represents the integer identifier 258.

target.mrk: For example, the string "#258" represents the integer identifier 258.

trans-unit.source: To reduce the amount of memory required for a resource, an application should refer to it by integer identifier instead of by name.

seg-source.mrk: To reduce the amount of memory required for a resource, an application should refer to it by integer identifier instead of by name.

target.mrk: To reduce the amount of memory required for a resource, an application should refer to it by integer identifier instead of by name.

trans-unit.source: An application can use _WinAPI_FindResource() to find any type of resource, but this function should be used only if the application must access the binary resource data when making subsequent calls to _WinAPI_LockResource().

seg-source.mrk: An application can use _WinAPI_FindResource() to find any type of resource, but this function should be used only if the application must access the binary resource data when making subsequent calls to _WinAPI_LockResource().

target.mrk: An application can use _WinAPI_FindResource() to find any type of resource, but this function should be used only if the application must access the binary resource data when making subsequent calls to _WinAPI_LockResource().
